original_title: Sri Lanka coconut prices rise 7.4-pct, more nuts offered
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s average coconut prices climbed 7.4 percent to a three week high at a weekly auction, Coconut Development Authority data showed.
The average price for 1,000 nuts was 144,000.12 rupees on August 28.
The number of nuts offered rose to 639,098 from 551,525 a week earlier, while nuts sold climbed to 531,960 from 519,803.
“The highest or the lowest price for a nut was not declared,” CDA officials told EconomyNext.
The Coconut Development Authority has not declared the highest and the lowest price for a nut since July 4.
Sri Lanka’s coconut production had recovered strongly in the second quarter of 2025.
June production has climbed 18 percent to 289.5 million nuts from a year earlier, official data showed.
Sri Lanka coconut recovers strongly June 2025, topping last year’s level
In the local market, the wholesale price for a large nut was 170-180 rupees, while small nuts were 150-160 a piece on August 28.
Local wholesale prices of coconut oil were 840,000 to 880,000 rupees per metric ton. (Colombo/Sep1/2025)
